Title: Taraba schools open doors to lifesaving vaccines
Summary: Schools across Taraba State, both public and private, are now eagerly opening their gates to health workers as the measles-rubella vaccination campaign sweeps through the entire state .

Title: Reported Planned Attack: Kogi govt urges residents to remain calm
Summary: Kogi govt urges residents to remain calm and vigilant following reports of a planned terrorist attack in parts of Kogi and Ondo states . The Kogi State Government has called on residents of the state to remain vigilant .

Title: Police officer arrested over shooting incident in Delta
Summary: Delta State Police Command has condemned the unprofessional conduct of a police officer caught on video shooting at a moving vehicle in Asaba . Police officer arrested over shooting incident in Delta .

Title: FG, partners launch green transport initiative to empower youth
Summary: FG, partners launch green transport initiative to empower youth . Initiative aims to empower Nigerian youth through sustainable transport and clean energy solutions . The Federal Government, through the Federal Ministry of Youth Development, has launched the initiative in partnership with National Commercial Tricycle and Motorcycle Owners and Riders Association of Nigeria .

Title: Zamfara police warn motorists against covering plate numbers
Summary: Zamfara State Police Command has issued a stern warning to motorists against covering plate numbers in the state . This was disclosed in a statement issued by the command’s spokesman, DSP Yazid Abubakar .

Title: LTC Climbs Toward $90, PI Gains Strength, BlockDAG’s Dashboard V4 and Binance AMA Set a New Standard for Transparency!
Summary: The crypto market continues to show signs of stabilization as select assets recover from recent corrections . Litecoin (LTC) has caught investor attention with its renewed price momentum near $90 . Pi Network (PI) is showing early signs of value recovery as its community regains confidence following weeks of uncertainty .

Title: Police arrest suspected kidnappers, bandits in Plateau
Summary: The Plateau State Commissioner of Police, CP Emmanuel Adesina, commended officers and men of the Command for their dedication to combating crime and ensuring public safety across the state .

Title: Opposition rejects proposal to limit political parties to 10
Summary: Opposition rejects proposal to limit political parties to 10 . Leading opposition figures strongly reject proposal . They say INEC should limit the number of political parties in Nigeria to a maximum of 10 .

Title: Migrant deported to France returns to UK on small boat
Summary: A migrant who was removed from the UK to France under a returns deal has been detained after re-entering Britain on a small boat, a government source confirmed Wednesday .

Title: Senate moves to double basic health care fund to 2% of consolidated revenue
Summary: Senate moves to double basic health care fund to 2% of consolidated revenue . Bill seeks to increase the Basic Health Care Provision Fund (BHCPF) from one percent (1%) to two percent of the Consolidated Revenue Fund (CRF) of the Federal Government .

Title: Davido appointed chairman Osun Sports Trust Fund
Electoral Act: Senate proposes shifting election proof burden to INEC
FG releases N32.9bn to strengthen PHCs, urges community ownership
France's ex-president Sarkozy to be protected by police officers in prison
